meanings.sent1: The loud noise was repelling the animals from the area.
meanings.sent2: She used a strong repellent to keep the mosquitoes away.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating snails was so repelling that it made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude was repelling positivity like a magnet repels the same poles.
meanings.sent5: The repelling force of the magnet was so strong, it pushed the other magnet away instantly.

meanings.definition: To cause aversion or distaste in
meanings.sent1: The foul smell was repelling customers from entering the store.
meanings.sent2: The taste of the medicine was so repelling that she couldn't swallow it.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing socks with sandals was so repelling that it made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her arrogance was repelling others like a strong gust of wind pushes away leaves.
meanings.sent5: The repelling odor coming from the garbage bin made everyone cover their noses.

meanings.definition: The act of repelling or the state of being repelled
meanings.sent1: The repelling of the two magnets created a fascinating display of physics.
meanings.sent2: The repelling of the two teams on the field was evident in their body language.
meanings.sent3: The repelling of the siblings was so strong that they couldn't agree on anything.
meanings.sent4: The repelling of positive and negative charges is what causes lightning in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The repelling of the two clouds created a clear patch of sky in between.
